definition: to be on tenterhooks (idiom)/to be anxious and frightened
content/calm/still/quiet/safe/secure/in good health/to find a place for/to install/to fix/to fit/to bring (a charge against sb)/to pacify/to harbor (good intentions)/security/safety/peace/ampere

sentences.english: Alexandra thrust her black-edged handkerchief nervously into her handbag .
sentences.chinese: 亞歷山德拉惴惴不安地把她那條黑邊的手帕塞進提包。

sentences.english: Readers, have you had experiences when you were on tenterhooks, struggling to deal with the unknown?
sentences.chinese: 讀者們，你們是否有提心吊膽，惴惴不安的經歷呢？

sentences.english: But after that he became more restless and nervous.
sentences.chinese: 然而此後他變得坐臥不寧，惴惴不安。

sentences.english: Uneasy but eager, the whole family waited for the eggs to hatch.
sentences.chinese: 全家都是惴惴不安地又很興奮地等候“收蠶”。

sentences.english: The big oil producers have good reason to be nervous.
sentences.chinese: 產油大國們的確有理由對現在的形勢惴惴不安。

sentences.english: Fear of the consequences preyed on her mind .
sentences.chinese: 她擔心其後果而惴惴不安。

definition: trembling with fear/with fear and trepidation
(saying) to be very scared and on edge
unable to sit or stand still (out of nervousness etc) (idiom)
anxious and perplexed/uneasy and confused/suspicious and fearful
deeply worried and sick at heart (idiom)
in fear and trepidation (idiom); in reverence before your majesty (court formula of humility)
lit. heart alarmed, trembling in fear (idiom); prostrate with fear/scared witless
